result.execSummary:
The defendant Bayron Jose Guzman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prostitution-Nonmmarital Sexual Intercourse, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.30(1m)(a).
  • Neglecting a Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs. Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11-02-15 or a civil judgment is ordered. Cash bail applied.

**10-23-15/ Thomas J McAdams**
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a TOTAL of 28 days of sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence; AS TO BOTTH COUNTS, with Huber privileges for work

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bayron Jose Guzman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant regarding sentence credit.
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.
Reflects 10-23-15 Court order for a total of 28 days of sentence credit
Denying Request for Additional Sentence Credit and Order Amending Judgment of Conviction.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. mag
Letter from defendant re: credit for time.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bayron Jose Guzman not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with credit of 37 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work. 
AS TO COUNT 2: Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence with Huber Privileges for work. 
Court orders no fine.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 11.2.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 11.2.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bayron Jose Guzman not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-02-2015 at 08:30 am.
ALL OTHER CONDITIONS OF BAIL REMAIN.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Bayron Jose Guzman not in court, in custody.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO COURT FILE. Court vacates warrant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-26-2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report - Discharge Summary - received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak previously in court.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel in court earlier in the morning but not when this case was called. Defense counsel has no explanation for the defendant's non-appearance. State requests a bench warrant be issued.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued. Court deferred a ruling on cash bail forfeiture until the return on the warrant.   COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. ADA Schindhelm will be handling this matter for the State.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

15RM026958  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/30/15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Bayron Jose Guzman in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Bayron Jose Guzman in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
